# Vista Graphics Overview Vista Graphics provides a declarative way to draw 2D graphics on HTML5 Canvas, inspired by the Rebol/View Draw dialect. ## Key Concepts - **Draw Block**: A block of drawing commands - **Pen**: The outline color/styling - **Fill Pen**: The fill color/styling - **Canvas**: The HTML5 canvas element ## Basic Drawing ` view .html [ canvas #myCanvas [ draw [ pen red fill-pen blue box 10 10 100 100 ] ] ] ` ## Drawing Commands - `line` - Draw a line between two points - `box` - Draw a rectangle - `circle` - Draw a circle - `ellipse` - Draw an ellipse - `polygon` - Draw a polygon - `text` - Draw text - `image` - Draw an image ## Color and Styling ` view .html [ canvas [ draw [ ; Named colors pen red fill-pen green ; RGB colors fill-pen 255 128 0 ; RGBA colors fill-pen 255 0 0 0.5 ; Gradients fill-pen linear-gradient 0 0 100 100 0.0 yellow 1.0 red box 10 10 100 100 ] ] ] ` ## Transformations ` view .html [ canvas [ draw [ translate 50 50 rotate 45 scale 2 2 pen blue box 0 0 100 100 ] ] ] ` ## Coordinate Systems Vista Graphics supports multiple coordinate systems: - **VID (default)**: Top-left origin, Y down - **Math**: Bottom-left origin, Y up - **Center**: Origin at canvas center ## See Also - [Drawing Primitives](/vista/wiki/graphics/drawing/primitives/) - Lines and shapes - [Transformations](/vista/wiki/graphics/transforms/transform-overview/) - Rotate, scale, translate - [Colors](/vista/wiki/graphics/colors/color-overview/) - Color and gradient reference
